format: A data frame with 62 observations on the following 16 variables.
title: Ozone Depleting Gas Index Data, 1992-2022
description:
Description
The NOAA Earth System Research Laboratory has an "ozone depleting gas index"
(ODGI) data set from 1992 to 2018. This dataset summarizes Table 1 and Table 2 from its website.
The primary interest here (for my purposes) is the ODGI indices
(including the new 2012 measure). The data set includes constituent greenhouse
gases/chlorines as well in parts per trillion. The primary use here is for
in-class illustration.

parameters.halons: aggregate concentration in parts per trillion of H-1211, H-1301 and H-2402
parameters.ch3cl: chloromethane concentration in parts per trillion
parameters.hcfcs: aggregate concentration in parts per trillion of HCFC-22, HCFC-141b, and HCFC-142b
parameters.ch3ccl3: methyl chloroform concentration in parts per trillion
parameters.wmo_minor: aggregate concentration in parts per trillion of CFC-114, CFC-115, halon 2402 and halon 1201
parameters.eesc: includes consideration of lag times for transport and mixing associated with transport. New as of 2012
parameters.sum: the sum of all greenhouse gas concentration measurements
parameters.odgi_old: old greenhouse gas index, no longer supported as of 2012
parameters.cfc11: CFC-11 concentration in parts per trillion
parameters.ch3br: bromomethane concentration in parts per trillion
parameters.cat: categorical variable for the Antarctic or Mid-Latitudes measurements
parameters.cfc113: trichlorotrifluoroethane concentration in parts per trillion
parameters.ccl4: carbon tetrachloride concentration in parts per trillion
parameters.cfc12: CFC-12 concentration in parts per trillion
parameters.odgi_new: new greenhouse gas index, as of 2012
